intro: Oxymeris nianga, commonly known as the Nianga tree, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and has a straight trunk with a smooth, greyish bark. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution in the region. Oxymeris nianga plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
